results.title: Matcham Skipper: metal sculptor
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Craftman and His Environment”.
A study of Matcham Skipper, one of Australia’s best known workers in silver, making jewellery and sculpting in silver at his studio in the old artists’ colony of Montsalvat, Victoria, in 1973. The film features the process of lost-wax casting. The film was funded by the Crafts Board of the Australia Council.

results.title: Match de Prestidigitation
results.brief_description: A magician divides himself into two people, who then perform tricks before transforming back into one person, in one of Georges Méliès’ early trick films that pioneered special effects.

constellations_other.name: Lost and found
constellations_other.description: Blossoming from Alice Guy Blaché’s The Cabbage-Patch Fairy, this Constellation explores the impermanence and enduring nature of the moving image.

results.title: Matalau: a Tolai Village in New Britain
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economic Change in a Developing Country”.
The last film in the series looks at a highly developed indigenous community - Matalau. Considers the impact Europeans have had on the traditional Tolai culture. Looks at the economy which is based on cash croppage - copra, cocoa, fishing and wage earning; and discusses future development.

results.title: Masters of modern sculpture. 3. New world
results.brief_description: Shows the influence of the European artists who came to New York with the end of World War II. Illustrates how they began to use all types of materials including wood, iron, steel, plastic, stone and plaster. Works include those by David Smith, John Chamberlain, Isamo Noguchi, Claus Oldenburg, and Christo. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Mastering change: video workbook [text]
results.brief_description: Change occurs in all the areas of our lives and cannot be avoided. This workbook, which accompanies the video set looks at skills which can be developed to successfully cope with and make the most of change.

results.title: Masterclass with Menuhin
results.brief_description: The Guelph Spring Festival provides the backdrop for this extraordinary meeting of two of the most impressive prodigies of the violin: 76 year old Yehudi Menuhin and 14 year old Corey Cerovsek. With the Camerata Lysy Gstaad, his own student orchestra from Switzerland, Menuhin - with characteristic warmth, humour and rigour - holds a master class for some of Canada’s violin students. The culmination is a dramatic performance of Bach’s “Double Violin Concerto” by Menuhin and Cerovsek. Rated: G

results.title: Master weavers of the Andes
results.brief_description: Examines the craft of weaving as practised by the Quechua Indians near Cuzco, Peru. Points out that except for the use of chemical dyes, the processes of spinning and weaving are practised as they have been for centuries. Camera and editing Peter Pilafian. Narrated by David Ossman.
